Please note that a ‘Welcome Letter’ must first be created as Microsoft mail merge template document.

The creation of Microsoft mail merge template documents is covered in a separate manual. 


Once the required options have been selected click the ‘Finish’ button.

If you selected the option to print a ‘Welcome Letter’ this document will not be printed automatically. The ‘Welcome Letter’ to print this will now open in the background in Microsoft Word, as long as Microsoft Word has been installed on this computer. Please note that installing and supporting Microsoft Word is not carried out by K3, this must be done by your own IT Department or external IT support company. If installed, click on the Microsoft Word icon on the taskbar to view and print this letter as required.

 

If you (i) have a member card printer attached that was supplied and installed by K3 and (ii) your membership type(s) in MStore have been configured to print member cards, then you will now see a screen asking you to select your member card printer. This is the standard Microsoft Windows printer selection screen, simply select the member card printer and ensure the quantity to print is as required, then tap the ‘Print’ button.

 

The till basket will show the total of all the fees expected even if they are paying by direct debit.


Press ‘Subtotal’ button as usual to show the payment methods.


If 'Gift Aid' was selected then you will now be presented with the 'Enter Gift Aid Details' screen.


The amount to pay will only be any "up-front" fees that must be paid at this point (e.g. the ‘Initial DD Fee’ if applicable).

(i)  If there are no payments necessary, you can press the ‘Cash’ button to complete the transaction. 

(ii) If there are any payments required, simply complete the transaction as usual, by taking the required amount using one of       the payment methods you have available (e.g. Credit Card, Cash etc).


In this scenario there were no up front payments and the £40 showing in the basket is to be paid by direct debit, so the 'Cash' button was pressed as the 'Amount to Pay' is £0. If there was any e.g. "up front fees" to pay that will not be paid for by direct debit, the 'Amount to Pay' will be populated with the money that needs to be paid "up front". If there was no amount to pay click the 'Ok' button twice to complete the transaction, pay the expected amount in the usual way.  


The below message will appear. Close the cash drawer in the usual way or tap this screen and this message disappears.

N.B. the member record(s) have now been created and can be found in the ‘Member’ database in MStore.

 

It is not necessary to find the member in the database at this point but for your information finding and amending member details is covered later in this guide.


 

Creating and Submitting the Initial Submission Instruction


Please note that for newly created members that have opted to use direct debits, before any direct debit payments can be taken a process needs to be carried out to both check that the bank account details that these members provided are correct and to set up the direct debit with the bank. This type of submission does not take any money from these members’ bank accounts and is known as the “Initial Instruction Submission” in MStore. A very brief overview of this process is given below:

 

(i) A file containing direct debit account details for checking is created using MStore.

(ii) This file is submitted by you to the bank electronically.

(iii) Your bank checks the details, which may take several days.

(iv) Your bank provides a response to say which accounts are OK and which are not.

 

The only part of the above process that is required in MStore, is to create the “Initial Instruction Submission” file. Please supply K3 with the preferred location of this file, so we can specify this location in the MStore software for you.

 

This procedure to create this file in the MStore back office software is explained below:

1. Click Setup > 2. Click Customer > 3. Double click Direct Debit Submissions


You will now see the screen below.

Now click on the button ‘Generate Initial Instruction Submission’ button.

 

This shows the account details for all members whose accounts need checking by your bank.

At this point click on the ‘Save’ button.


Now click on the ‘Create Submission File’ button, at the bottom left of the screen.

 

At this point, the submission file is created as a text file, which should open in Microsoft Notepad.

 The file will be in the format of the example shown above.

Please note in some versions of Windows this file may not show automatically on your screen.

 

If not, then look on your Windows ‘Taskbar’ and click on the  icon to view the file.

Please note – DO NOT make any changes to this text file!

       

Please make a note of the filename in the top left corner of the above screen (in this example it is BACSUB001.TXT), as you need to submit this specific file to your bank. This file will be automatically saved in the location you specified.

 

From the main menu in simply select ‘File’ button.

Now click the ‘Exit’ button at the bottom of the dropdown. Alternatively click the cross button in the top right corner.

 

Now you need to submit this file electronically to your bank. N.B. K3 cannot advise you on this process of how to submit the “Initial Instruction Submission” file to your bank. You will need to consult your bank and they must inform you as to how you submit this file electronically.


Once you have submitted the file to your bank all you need to do in MStore is to record:

(i) the date that this file was submitted to your bank and (ii) the person who made the submission.

 

Use the ‘Submitted to BACS On:” drop-down selector select the date you submitted this file to the bank.

Use the drop-down selector here to select the person that submitted this file to the bank.

 

Once you selected the required click on the ‘Save’ button at the bottom right of the screen.


Now simply click on the ‘Close’ button at the bottom right of the screen.

As you aware this process submits the account details of new members for checking. However, whenever you either update or edit the account details of an existing member in MStore that pays by direct debit, this process also submits these account details for checking. Please note that this check batch will not take any money from these members’ bank accounts. For this reason, it is recommended that you carry out the submission of the “Initial Instruction Submission” file to your bank every week. This is so that you are informed by the bank as soon as possible as to any bank account issues.

 

You now wait until you get notification from the bank as to whether the direct debit ‘initial instruction submission’ has been approved or rejected. Please consult with your bank about how long this procedure will take them to carry out and how they notify you as to whether the ‘initial instruction submission’ has been approved or rejected. K3 cannot advise you on this process.

 

For your information, the bank normally refers to these results as the Advice of Direct Debit Amendments and Cancellations (also referred to as ADDACS). Once you receive these ADDACS results from your bank you need to go into MStore and mark which accounts were OK and which account were not OK.

 


Marking Accounts as Ok / Not Ok - After Receiving ADDACS


When you receive the ADDACS results from the bank, go back into ‘Direct Debit Submissions’:

1. Click Setup > 2. Click Customer > 3. Double click Direct Debit Submissions

 

All your direct debit submissions will show in this screen.

Initial submission instructions that were created will show in the ‘Type’ column as ‘A/C Check’.

Double click on the relevant initial submission instruction that you need to process.

 

As seen previously this will open a screen showing all the accounts details of the members that

were included in that “Initial Submission Instruction” submission batch.


You then need to click on the relevant account, so it is highlighted yellow.

Now right mouse click on the selected account to bring up the options (as shown above).

 

For each account where the direct debit received the banks approval, select ‘Mark Account as Ok’.

You will see the above message pop up - click ‘OK’ to confirm this change.

 

Repeat the procedure until all the required accounts are marked.

 

For all accounts where ‘Mark Account as Ok’ was selected, you are now able to generate a submission file.

Proceed to section entitled “How to Generate a New Submission”.

 

Please note for speed if ALL accounts were ok, you can just click the ‘Mark All Accounts as Ok’ at the bottom of the screen. But if you do this you then please remember you WILL NOT be able to undo this from this screen, or use the ‘Mark Account as Not Ok’ option (explained next) for any account in this initial instruction submission batch.


Alternatively, where the bank declines an account in the check batch, right click the required member’s account.

This will bring up the options (as shown below). Select ‘Mark Account as Not OK’.

 

Click ‘OK’ to confirm this change.

For all the above accounts, you now must check and correct the member(s) bank account details


See the next section that covers with how to Deal with 'Accounts that Fail the ‘Initial Submission Instruction’.

If there were no ADDAC’s failures, please proceed to the section 'How to ‘Generate a New Submission’ (Taking Payment)'.


 


Accounts that Fail the ‘Initial Submission Instruction’


For all accounts where the ‘Mark Account as Not OK’ was selected you must go back to the member(s) and inform them that the bank rejected the initial instruction submission. For each member where the bank rejected the initial instruction submission, they need to confirm that both the bank account details that they provided were correct. If there are any amendments that need to be made, then these must be made in the ‘Member Details’ screen. This is most easily accessed while you still have the below screen open. Right click any member where the ‘Mark Account as Not Ok’ option was selected and then left click ‘Edit Member’ option .

 

The below screen appears. Click on the ‘Direct Debit’ tab.

 

N.B. for any member’s account where ‘Mark Account as Not OK’ was selected, you will notice that the status here now appears as ‘A/C Invalid’. 

 

Amend the details (e.g. ‘Name of Account Holder’, ‘Sort Code’ and ‘A/C Number’ etc) in this screen as required.

Click ‘OK’ once the required information has been entered.

You will now notice the status of this account will now change from ‘A/C Invalid’ to ‘Not Checked’.

Next click the ‘Close’ button.

 

For all accounts whose status is now ‘Not Checked’, follow the procedure in the section entitled 'Creating and Submitting the Initial Submission Instruction'.


 

How to ‘Generate a New Submission’ (Taking Payment)


For all accounts where ‘Mark Account as Ok’ was selected, it is now possible to initiate the

procedure to submit this information that instructs your bank to collect these direct debit payments.

To do this, click on ‘Generate New Submission’ button.

You must now specify the date up to which you are collecting the direct debit payments for.

This is done using the ‘Payments up to and including’ drop-down selection.

Click on the drop-down arrow then select the required date from the calendar.

 

Please Note:

You should consult your bank as to when you need to carry out your direct debit submission by. For example, you want to carry out a submission every month for ‘Payments up to and including’ the last day of that specific month. Your bank may specify that in order to have sufficient time to process this request this submission must be carried out and submitted to them sent by e.g. the 14th of each month. This means that you may have to carry out the above process on e.g. the 14th of each month but select ‘Payments up to and including’ date as the last day of that month. Once you have selected the required ‘Payments up to and including’ date, then click on the ‘Go’ button.

 

You are now asked if you want to generate a new submission file to the bank for the date criteria selected

(referred to as a “DD Batch”). Then click on ‘OK’ to proceed with creating the submission file.

 

If there are direct debits due for collection for the date selected, then you will see the following message.

Then click on ‘OK’.
 

N.B. if there are no direct debits to submit for the selected period, the following screen appears. 

Click ‘Click ‘OK’ if you see this screen.

 

Assuming there were direct debits to collect, you will now see the following screen.

This shows the each member’s bank account and payment details that will be included in the submission file.

 

Next  click the ‘Create Submission File’ button.

 

The submission file is created as a text file, which should open in Microsoft Notepad (sample content given below).

The file will be in the format of the example shown above.

As stated previously in some versions of Microsoft Windows this file may not show automatically on screen.

If so then look on your Windows ‘Taskbar’ and click on the Notepad icon to view the file.

 

Please note - do not make any changes to this text file!

Please make a note of the filename at the top of the screen, in this case it is BACSUB001.txt. You need to submit this specific file to your bank for this submission. Please note the number at the end of the filename (BACSUB001.txt) relates to the batch number in MStore (in the above screenshot this filename is for Batch 1 in MStore).

 

This file will be automatically saved in the location you specified previously.

(as defined in Setup > System > System Options > Membership tab > Direct Debit Submissions Folder)

 

From the main menu in simply select ‘File’ button.

Now click the ‘Exit’ button at the bottom of the dropdown (alternatively click the cross in the top right corner).

 

Please note that unlike the Initial Instruction Submission’ “check batch”, once you submit this batch to the bank this will initiate the process to try and collect direct debit payments from these member’s bank accounts!

Do not submit this file to your bank unless you have checked the contents of this batch are correct.

 

Now you need to submit this file electronically to your bank. K3 cannot advise you on this process of how and when to submit this file to your bank. You will need to consult your bank and they must inform you as to how you submit this file electronically. Once you have submitted the file to your bank all you need to do in MStore is to record:

 

(i) the date that this file was submitted to your bank and (ii) the person who made the submission.

 

Use the ‘Submitted to BACS On:’ drop-down selector to select the date you submitted this file to the bank.

Select today’s date or if this was not submitted today, select the required date from the calendar.

Next use the ‘Submitted to BACS By:’ drop-down selector to record who submitted this file to the bank.

Click on the drop-down arrow here and select the required back office ‘User’ from the list.

Once the required date and user name has been selected, click the ‘Save’ button (which will now be active).

Next click the ‘Close’ button.
 


Marking Accounts as ‘Ok’/‘Not Ok’ after receiving ARUDDS


When you receive the ARUDDS (Automatic Return of Unpaid Direct Debits) from bank:

1. Click Setup > 2. Click Customer > 3. Double click Direct Debit Submissions.

 

All your direct debit submissions will show in this screen. New submissions that were created will show in the ‘Type’ column as ‘Normal’. Double click on the relevant submission that you need to process.

 

This will open a screen showing all the accounts details of the members that were included in that submission.

You will notice that in the ‘Note’ column these show as ‘Outstanding’.

This is because these are direct debit payments that are awaiting you to confirm that have been paid. 


Now click on the ‘Mark All Payments as Ok’ button.

A message will appear confirming the number of records updated. Click 'Ok'.

 

You will see the that each direct debit payment record has now changed to ‘Paid’ in the ‘Note’ column.

 

Now for any direct debit payment that failed collection, right mouse click on the payment.

Now with a left mouse click, select ‘Mark Payment as Failed’.

Repeat the procedure until all the accounts are marked as required.

For all people whose direct debit payment failed, please note that K3 cannot give you the explanation for the failure. You would have to contact your bank directly for the reason for direct debit payment failures.

 

Once you have contacted your bank you would need to contact the member(s) concerned, e.g.  to confirm their bank account details, take payment by another method (e.g. cash, cheque or credit card) , or arrange for an increased/additional direct debit payment to be set up to cover the failed payment.


The payment may have failed due the customer changing their bank account details since they were originally provided. Checking and amending bank account details is covered later in this guide.

 

If the failed payment needs to be taken on a till you would need an appropriately named PLU to be set up in in MStore (e.g. ‘Failed DD Payment’), which must be set up with the ‘Override Price’ set to ‘Forced Price Entry’. You would then use the ‘Find Member’ button on the till to find the member before selling the ‘Failed DD Payment’ PLU to the required method of payment. Please note setting up PLU’s and till buttons is not covered in the scope of this manual.

 

Alternatively a member might want to:

(i)     cancel the membership, direct debit instruction and any outstanding payments.

(ii)    re-schedule the direct debit payment for the next convenient date as required.

Both these processes are covered later in this guide.


Please note in this screen you can also cancel the direct debit and membership in the below screen.

Simply right click the required record and select the ‘Cancel D/D and Membership’ option.
 

At the next screen click the ‘Yes’ button.

This will cancel their direct debit authorisation, any outstanding payments and also expire their membership.


Once you have finished in this screen click ‘Close’ then ‘Close’ again to exit the ‘Direct Debits’ screen.

 

Alternatively, if you do not find out at this point that a customer wants to cancel, the process of cancelling a direct debit is explained in the following section.


 

Dealing with Members no Longer Paying by Direct Debit


For each member who responds confirming they do not want to continue to pay for their membership via direct debit, you need to amend that member’s record to reflect this. Find and open this member’s record and access the direct debit details (as explained in previous sections).

 Next click the ‘Cancel Authorisation’ button.

 

At the following screen click 'Yes' (or click 'No' if you do not want to do this now).

 

Any payments that were outstanding will now be marked 'Payment Cancelled' (see ‘Current Payments’ section of screen).


You should now also click on the drop down here and select ‘A/C Invalid’.

Next click the ‘OK’ button (at the bottom of the screen) to accept this change.


You will notice that the information in the ‘History’ section has updated to show these actions.

You will notice that the information in the ‘History’ section has updated to show these actions.

 

You now must ensure you change the ‘Expires On’ date. This could be set to today’s date or a past and future date.

This really depends on your terms and conditions as to when their membership expires on cancelling a direct debit.

Click the ‘Ok’ button to accept the change.

Repeat the process for each member as required.



Editing Direct Debit Payments

 

There may be the need to change the direct payment schedule for a member. Common examples would be to e.g. amend the value of a current payment, create a totally new payment, or change the status of a current payment. These scenarios are explained below.

 

Important Note:

Although the MStore software has the flexibility to allows you to amend / add direct debit payment please first check with your direct debits expert and / or your bank whether you are legally allowed to amend a direct debit payment and what consent / documentation you may legally require to do so. 

 

First find and open the member record and click on the ‘Direct Debit’ tab.


Next click on the ‘Edit’ button.


Please note when adding or removing or amending direct debit payments it is optional whether this will create a transaction in MStore which will post a +ve or -ve adjustment to a specified till in MStore. If this is required please contact your Customer Success Account Manager for a quote for the necessary configuration and training to enable this functionality (also see below *). By default no transaction will be made on adding / adjusting / cancelling direct debit payments, unless this functionality have been previously enabled. 

 

You can click on any existing payment so it is highlighted, then amend the details as required. 

Click 'Save' once the required changes are made.


The fields that can be amended are:

 

Collection date:                    Use the date drop-down selector to select the required date for this payment.

Collection Amount:             Amend the amount in this box to be as required.

Transaction Type:                Use the date drop-down selector to select from the available options as required.

                                              (i.e. ‘First Collection’, ‘Normal Collection, ‘Represented Collection’, or ‘Final Collection’)

‘Status’:                                Click the required status to select from the available options as required.

                                              (i.e. ‘Outstanding’, ‘Paid’, ‘Payment Failed’, or ‘Payment Cancelled’).

 

Please not you can also remove a payment. 

Click on the payment so that it is highlighted yellow, then click on the  button.

 

If required you can also create a totally new direct debit payment.

To do this click on the ‘New’ button to create a new payment.

Enter the required details and check these, then click 'Save'.


Once all the payments in this screen have been amended as required, click  ‘Close’.


Please note (see above*) if on clicking 'Close' you see a message (like the one below) stating that either a positive or negative adjustment has been posted. This means you have the setup already in place that is creating a positive or negative adjustment that will be reflected in your transaction reports for the date you made the adjustment.

 

At the next ('Member Details') screen click ‘Close’ again to return to the main ‘Members’ screen.



Direct Debit Renewals


To carry out direct debit renewals click on the ‘Members’ button then the ‘Renew DDs’ button.


You now must select the required date criteria for the direct debit memberships you want to renew.

 

(i) ‘Renewal all Direct Debit members expiring on or before’.

Select the membership expiry date for direct debt memberships that you want to renew. For most organisations that offer direct debits this is typically a date several weeks ahead of today’s date, as this process is typically carried out several weeks in advance. The exact number of weeks in advance of the expiry will need to be decided by your own organisation’s requirements, but could be e.g. we six weeks in advance of the membership expiry dates. For example, for all customers whose direct debits  memberships are due to expire on or before the 31st of December, then you may want to carry out process should be carried out in e.g. mid-October. This is to allow adequate time for any direct debit letters to be sent, received and responses returned by your direct debit members and then any action to be taken in MStore as required.

 

(ii) ‘Direct Debit Scheme’

Next select the required direct debit scheme you want to run renewals for. This will default to ‘Renew All Schemes’. For those customers who offer multiple direct debit payment schemes (e.g. annual and monthly),if required you can run the renewals process separately. However many customers have only a single direct debit scheme, or are happy to run the renewal for all direct debit schemes (for the expiry date selected in step 1). Select as required for the way you want to control and run the direct debit renewals process.


(iii) ‘Show All Direct Debits for Renewal’

Once steps 1 and 2 have been done and checked, click the ‘Show All Direct Debits for Renewal’ button to see the memberships that will be renewed. Please note clicking this does not carry out the renewal itself. This allows you to view and check the direct debit memberships that would be renewed if you carry out the relevant steps to renew the members displayed when you click the ‘Show All Direct Debits for Renewal’ button.
 

1. You will now see the direct memberships that will be renewed.


2. If required you can click the extra options which will add extra data into the grid (if applicable)

 

‘Show All Members’

Clicking this will show all the members being paid for by direct debit (where applicable) under each bank account.

It is quite normal for two or more memberships being paid for by direct debit from one person’s bank account, as in MStore you can sign up multiple membership at a time under one “family” account.

 

‘Show All Columns’

This adds extra columns of data into he results which may be required.

 

Export to Excel

Once the required options are selected and before the renewal has been completed, then (if required) the records that are about to be renewed can be exported to Microsoft (MS) Excel at this point by clicking the ‘Export to Excel’ button that is located at the bottom left corner of the ‘Direct Debit Renewals’ screen.

That is as long as your IT Team have installed Excel on your computer. Clicking this button should open the results in Excel. If there are any issues ask your IT team to investigate, as MS Excel has its own security (‘Trust Center’) settings that can prevent third part application like MStore from opening MS Excel. If there are still issues then you or they can log a ticket with K3’s Support team to investigate further.

 

Click the Excel iconon your computer’s 'Taskbar' to view this export.


If required you can then save these results as an Excel file in the usual way to the required location, this allows you’re your organisation to save a record of what is being renewed by this process. This is the easiest way to retain an audit trail of which direct debit memberships have been renewed by this process. 

 

To renew these listed direct debit members in MStore now click the ‘Renew All Listed DDs’ button.

You will then see the following screen, to proceed with the renewals click ‘Yes’ if you want to renew the members.

Alternatively, if you are unsure and want to make any checks at this point click ‘No’ or ‘Cancel’.

For example you may have forgotten to do the export to Excel, so you could click ‘No’ and run the export.

 

For all the members listed (if required) you can now generate their direct debit renewal letter using the Word’s mail merge functionality in MS Word. This will require your IT team to have installed MS Word on your computer. To use this functionality you will have already need to have had training on and know how to set up MS Word mail merge templates using MStore. Please note this content us covered in a separate user guide.

 

Click the   button where shown and the Windows ‘File Explorer’ screen will appear.

Navigate to and select the require mail merge template documents you have already set up (see above *).

Click on the required MS mail merge template document and then click the ‘Open’ button.

 

1. The selected MS mail merge template document will now appear where shown.

 

2. On clicking the ‘Print Letters using Microsoft Word’ the following pop-up message appears.


 If Microsoft Word was not already open the ‘Word’ icon  will now be showing on your task bar.


Please note as with the ‘Export to Excel’ functionality, MS Word has its own security (‘Trust Center’) settings that can prevent third part application like MStore from opening MS Word. If MS Word does not open or errors at this point please get your own IT to check the relevant Microsoft security settings. If there are still issues then you or they can log a ticket with K3’s Support team to investigate further to see if they can assist but please note K3 do not (i) provide support or (ii) training on using Microsoft Word itself, including how to use it mail merge functionality.

 

For some versions of Word it has been noted that unless you first minimise then maximise the Word application then you are not able to access all the mail merge functionality withing MS Word and that is out of K3’s control. If when MS Word opens nothing happens when you click mail merge specific functionality in MS Word, then please minimise then maximise the Word application.

 

Carry out the mail merge in MS Word and save any Word documents as required.

Save any documents before exiting the MS Word application.

 

Please note if you decide not to proceed with carrying out any mail merge in Word and try and close the MStore ‘Direct Debit Renewals’ screen without carrying out a mail merge in Word, you will get a pop up warning and reminder in MStore.

Clicking ‘Cancel’ will return the MStore ‘Direct Debit Renewals’.

So if required you could still follow the process and carry out a mail merge using MS Word.

Clicking ‘Ok’ will close the MStore ‘Direct Debit Renewals’ screen.

 

All the direct debit members that were listed in the MStore ‘Direct Debit Renewals’ screen. are now renewed and the process to generate the required submission files and will continue as normal.

 

If you first selected a specific direct debit scheme (as opposed to the ‘Renew All Schemes’ ) then (if you have more than one direct debit scheme) then you may need to repeat the above process as explained above for each ‘Direct Debit Scheme’.

As discussed previously the above direct debit renewal process is often typically carried out several weeks in advance of expiry depending on your organizations' requirements. The reason for this is to enable you to have time to process each member’s response to sending out your direct debit renewal letters prior to the next submission being generated using MStore. For each member who responds confirming they do not want to continue to pay for their membership via direct debit, this allows adequate time for you to cancel any member(s) direct debit authorisation in MStore prior to the next submission. This process must be done to stop further direct debit payments being taken.

 

To see how to cancel a member’s direct debit authorisation in MStore is covered in a previous section entitled 'Dealing with Members no Longer Paying by Direct Debit'. Alternatively, for members that wish to continue to pay for their membership via direct debit, then no further action is required. Their details will continue to be submitted by the direct debit submissions files processes as detailed in the earlier sections on creating / processing direct debit submission files.

 

Please Note:

The direct debit renewals process will automatically renew the memberships of all relevant members and it will update their expiry date to the new one. The new direct debit payments will automatically be created in each of the direct debit memberships renewed by this process (under a new ‘Auth Number’). This can be seen if you find and open a direct debit member record that has been renewed by clicking the ‘Direct Debit’ tab. By default you will be seeing direct debit payments for the current ‘Auth Number’. But you can click on the dropdown selector and select the required ‘Auth Number’ to the historic information. This is useful to know for auditing and troubleshooting purposes. 

 

N.B. the first payment direct debit payments history will show under ‘Auth Number’ 1, then when they are renewed the next lot of direct debt payments that are expected will show under ‘Auth Number’ 2. This number will increase by 1 each time their direct debit memberships are renewed.

text: Q) - Why when I complete a future booking today and select to complete it for the date booked does it appear in the daily transaction analysis for today? title: Does completing a future booking appear in the daily transaction analysis ?

text: The Marketing Questionnaire is not enabled by default. Click on Edit, View/Edit Questions: Add questions as required: Add a Questionnaire name and section (the questionnaire can be broken down into multiple sections if required) Add each question that is required. (If you want to include questions set up on a scale, you need to enable the 'Use on a scale' tick box: Add the required questions: Enabling access for the questionnaire. Within Security groups you will now find the option to 'Allow Marketing Questionnaire' Right click to enable: (This needs to be enabled for every group of users that requires access to it) Within System Options click on the User Defined tab, you can then select the questionnaire you have just created to make it active. text: This is the guide to install the MStore Back Office software onto Back Office PC's. Request your sites MStore.ini file from K3 support via the portal: https://support.k3btg.com/ or emailing support@k3btg.com. Download MStore3.15Setup.exe from the below Dropbox link: MStore3.15Setup.exe. a) You do not need to log into Drop Box to Download this file. Click Download, as shown below. b) Then click Or continue with download only. Your download will then begin. Grant full permissions for the following folders for all users: C:\ProgramData\Merac C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac (or C:\Program Files\Merac if your PC is 32-bit).See Permission Denied Error for more detail Copy the MStore.ini file you received from K3 support to the following location: C:\ProgramData\Merac. title: Installing MStore 3.15+ Back Office For Back Office PC's
description:
This is the guide to install the MStore Back Office software onto Back Office PC's. This can be performed by PC users or IT departments on the users behalf, with administrator privileges on the PC in question. Please note, this is not suitable for Windows XP PC's.


  1. Request your sites MStore.ini file from K3 support via the portal: https://support.k3btg.com/ or emailing support@k3btg.com. If this is a re-install, where no files were manually changed, or the server details have not changed, then you can skip this step.
  2. Download MStore3.15Setup.exe from the below Dropbox link: MStore3.15Setup.exe.
    a) You do not need to log into Drop Box to Download this file. Click Download, as shown below.

    b) Then click Or continue with download only. Your download will then begin.
  3. Once your download has completed, please run MStore3.15Setup.exe from your Downloads folder.
  4. Grant full permissions for the following folders for all users:
    • C:\ProgramData\Merac
    • C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac (or C:\Program Files\Merac if your PC is 32-bit).See Permission Denied Error for more detail
  5. Copy the MStore.ini file you received from K3 support to the following location: C:\ProgramData\Merac.
  6.  Restart your PC to download the latest files for your version from your database. Alternatively, you can open Windows Services, and restart the MeracUpdater service, waiting 30 seconds to get the same result. 
  7. Open the Merac Back Office (PMBOS.exe), making sure you do not get any error or ‘out of date’ messages when you log into the Back Office. If you do receive an error, please double-check the above steps, try again, and then contact K3 support to investigate.

text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Issue Solution Issue Within either the Back Office or the till program; You are renewing memberships, and the Expires date calculated from the Start Date is showing shorter than the duration of the membership set in Membership Types. Solution This can be due to the Scheme Valid Until date set for that Membership Type within the Back Office, in Setup, Membership Types. If you extend this into the future, the correct membership duration will be calculated, until the Scheme Valid Until date is inside the duration of the membership set. This would be a good time to review all your other valid Membership Types, so you don't get the same issues with these. description:

  • Solution

Issue

Within either the Back Office or the till program; You are renewing memberships, and the Expires date calculated from the Start Date is showing shorter than the duration of the membership set in Membership Types. 




Solution

This can be due to the Scheme Valid Until date set for that Membership Type within the Back Office, in Setup, Membership Types.


If you extend this into the future, the correct membership duration will be calculated, until the Scheme Valid Until date is inside the duration of the membership set.


This would be a good time to review all your other valid Membership Types, so you don't get the same issues with these. You will need to recreate till data and update any till to be aware of this update.

text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Remove Task View button from the Task Bar Stop Windows Storing 'my activity history on this device' Disable 'Allow Edge Swipe' If you want to disable Task View in Windows 10, because this allows users to access anything other than what the device is used for, you can follow the below: Remove Task View button from the Task Bar Right-click on the Task View icon. click on Show Task View button. Stop Windows Storing 'my activity history on this device' Type in Settings into the Windows Start Bar, clicking on the Settings app. Click on the Privacy button. Click on Activity history. Untick Store my activity history on this device, and Clear activity history. Disable 'Allow Edge Swipe' Type in Group Policy into Windows Start Menu. Click on Edit Group Policy. Within Group Policy Editor, Click on Administrative Templates, Windows Components, Edge UI. Double-click on Allow edge swipe. In this window, click the Disabled radial button, and then OK. Any edge swipes will no longer invoke an system UI.
title: Disable Task View & Edge Swiping In Windows 10
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Remove Task View button from the Task Bar
  • Stop Windows Storing 'my activity history on this device'
  • Disable 'Allow Edge Swipe'


If you want to disable Task View in Windows 10, because this allows users to access anything other than what the device is used for, you can follow the below:


Remove Task View button from the Task Bar

  1. Right-click on the Task View icon.
  2. click on Show Task View button.


Stop Windows Storing 'my activity history on this device'

  1. Type in Settings into the Windows Start Bar, clicking on the Settings app.
  2. Click on the Privacy button.
  3. Click on Activity history.
  4. Untick Store my activity history on this device, and Clear activity history.


Disable 'Allow Edge Swipe'

  1. Type in Group Policy into Windows Start Menu.
  2. Click on Edit Group Policy.
  3. Within Group Policy Editor, Click on Administrative Templates, Windows Components, Edge UI.
  4. Double-click on Allow edge swipe.
  5. In this window, click the Disabled radial button, and then OK.


Any edge swipes will no longer invoke an system UI.

text: If your documents are stuck in the print queue and nothing is printing, don’t worry — clearing the print queue usually fixes the issue. Follow the steps below to cancel all pending print jobs and start fresh. Step-by-Step: Clear the Print Queue Option 1: Using the Printer Menu Open the Start Menu and search for Printers & Scanners. Click on your printer from the list. Select Open print queue (you might need to right click) In the new window, click Printer in the top menu, then select Cancel All Documents. Confirm the action if prompted. If this doesn’t work or the queue is stuck, try the manual method below. Option 2: Manually Restart the Print Spooler Open the Start Menu, search for Services, and open it. Scroll down and find Print Spooler in the list. Right-click it and choose Stop. Open File Explorer and go to: C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS (You may need admin permissions.) Delete all files in this folder — these are the stuck print jobs. Go back to the Services window, right-click Print Spooler again, and choose Start. That's it.
title: How to Clear the Print Queue in Windows
description:
If your documents are stuck in the print queue and nothing is printing, don’t worry — clearing the print queue usually fixes the issue. Follow the steps below to cancel all pending print jobs and start fresh.


Step-by-Step: Clear the Print Queue

Option 1: Using the Printer Menu

  1. Open the Start Menu and search for Printers & Scanners.

  2. Click on your printer from the list.

  3. Select Open print queue (you might need to right click)

  4. In the new window, click Printer in the top menu, then select Cancel All Documents.

  5. Confirm the action if prompted.

If this doesn’t work or the queue is stuck, try the manual method below.


Option 2: Manually Restart the Print Spooler

  1. Open the Start Menu, search for Services, and open it.

  2. Scroll down and find Print Spooler in the list.

  3. Right-click it and choose Stop.

  4. Open File Explorer and go to:
    C:\Windows\System32\spool\PRINTERS
    (You may need admin permissions.)

  5. Delete all files in this folder — these are the stuck print jobs.

  6. Go back to the Services window, right-click Print Spooler again, and choose Start.


That's it.

text: When trying to print tickets to the Bixolon printer. it feeds multiple tickets through causing ticket wastage. It may just be that the printer needs re calibrating to the ticket stock. There’s separate instructions for calibrating labels with gap sensors and labels with black timing marks. Make sure you are using the correct one! Below are the instructions for calibrating a Bixolon SLP-DX420: Gap Sensor Calibration Press and hold the Pause button for 2 Seconds Press the Feed button when LED 1 is orange and LED 2 blinks green 4 times Black Timing Mark Press and hold the Pause button for 2 Seconds Press the Feed button when LED 1 is orange and LED 2 blinks orange 4 times To see a video of this go to the following link. https://www.smithcorona.com/blog/how-to-calibrate-a-bixolon-slp-dx420/?srsltid=AfmBOopUfgF0Ah2DrU3x5gZzdSJglKpYh9QUOaOKbMRkATuFJidRuAOX

text: If you think that your site may have stuck transactions and want to know, follow the below to check for signs of this. First you check the Till screen in the back office for signs. The most obvious sign will be an open till drawer for a till in use that has been opened days/month in the past. If you open and close the cash drawers daily this will be a big sign of stuck transactions. You can also check the that the draw number on the till in the tills screen matches the one in use on the till. Another sign is that if you open the till details and there are zero transactions and figures processed through the till. This is a sign that your till is not sending the transactions to the database or that they are stuck in the SQL table. Incorrect Till and not uploading. Correct till and up to date.
title: How to check if you have stuck transactions
description:
If you think that your site may have stuck transactions and want to know, follow the below to check for signs of this. 


First you check the Till screen in the back office for signs. The most obvious sign will be an open till drawer for a till in use that has been opened days/month in the past. If you open and close the cash drawers daily this will be a big sign of stuck transactions. 


You can also check the that the draw number on the till in the tills screen matches the one in use on the till.


Another sign is that if you open the till details and there are zero transactions and figures processed through the till. This is a sign that your till is not sending the transactions to the database or that they are stuck in the SQL table. 


Incorrect Till and not uploading. 



Correct till and up to date.

text: If you are finding that you have tickets duplicate on the website as below where the description is only shown once and then subsequently with quotation marks: This is down to the fact the website thinks there are multiple different time slots available. When sessions are not used, the system uses the calendar to define which days the PLU can be sold and the time slot to define at which times the tickets are available. In the instance where you have a time slot with multiple times, these will be treated as separate time slots available to book and therefore will result in duplication. By updating the time slot (or creating a new one if used elsewhere) to only have a specific time, this will remove duplication: (Ensure you update the web templates, and refresh the webpage)

text: If a customer does not receive their booking confirmation email for any reason, you can re-send this email yourself. You can also perform this process to test whether confirmation emails are being sent or not. You will need the online booking reference/online shop order number. This could be found by searching for the booking reference/order number via the customers name with the Back Office. You would also require password to login to your website Back Office portal. Please note: This will only be able to recall online bookings/orders, and always show the items purchased on the website when the booking was created, and will not show any different items if they were added/removed in the Back Office. Once you have this information, you can follow this process: Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access. The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on Complete Paid Orders. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal here. Here, you can insert the Booking Ref or Order Number in the relevant box, then clicking the relevant Look Up button. When the booking/order is found, you can then type in the email address that you would like the online booking confirmation email to be sent to. Then press Resend Email. We recommend to not use the Send Multiple Email functionality. Depending on sending and receiving emails with yours and the receivers email server, this can take up to half an hour to be received. You may perform this multiple times, if you wish.

text: If MStore does not receive confirmation of a successful payment for an online booking from your online payment provider, the booking will be marked as an unpaid reservation within the Back Office. However, if you know the payment has gone through, you can manually mark this booking as paid. You will need the online booking reference/online shop order number. This could be found by searching for the booking reference/order number via the customers name with the Back Office. You would also require password to login to your website Back Office portal. Please note: This will only be able to recall online bookings/orders, and always show the items purchased on the website when the booking was created, and will not show any different items if they were added/removed in the Back Office. Once you have this information, you can follow this process: Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access. The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on Complete Paid Orders. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal here. Here, you can insert the Booking Ref or Order Number in the relevant box, then clicking the relevant Look Up button. When the booking/order is found, with a status of Reserved, you can press Complete, which will send payment successful for the booking in question to the MStore system. Depending on sending and receiving emails with yours and the receivers email server, this can take up to half an hour to be received.

description:
If MStore does not receive confirmation of a successful payment for an online booking from your online payment provider, the booking will be marked as an unpaid reservation within the Back Office. However, if you know the payment has gone through, you can manually mark this booking as paid.


You will need the online booking reference/online shop order number.  This could be found by searching for the booking reference/order number via the customers name with the Back Office. You would also require password to login to your website Back Office portal.


Please note: This will only be able to recall online bookings/orders, and always show the items purchased on the website when the booking was created, and will not show any different items if they were added/removed in the Back Office.


Once you have this information, you can follow this process:

  1. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. 
  2. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login.
  3. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access.

    The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office.
  4. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on Complete Paid Orders. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal here.
  5. Here, you can insert the Booking Ref or Order Number in the relevant box, then clicking the relevant Look Up button.
  6. When the booking/order is found, with a status of Reserved, you can press Complete, which will send payment successful for the booking in question to the MStore system.

    This will then display the booking successful web page. This will also send an email to the email address linked to the booking. Depending on sending and receiving emails with yours and the receivers email server, this can take up to half an hour to be received.

EMAILFROMADD - This is the email address used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from. EMAILSERVER - This is the email exchange server used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website. EMAILSERVERUID - This is the email exchange user account used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website. EMAILSERVERPWD - This is the email exchange server password used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website. title: Amending Your MStore Email Server Details For Online Bookings, Memberships And Shop Orders
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Amending MStore Email Server Details
  • Testing


Amending MStore Email Server Details


If you need to change your email server details that your MStore website uses to send booking, membership and shop order confirmation emails, you can follow the below process.


  1. Within the Back Office, Click Setup, Bookings, then Booking Templates. 

  2. Once Booking Templates is opened, click on Website login.
  3. This will take you to your website Back Office portal, where you will need to insert your website Back Office portal password for access.

    The person at your site who regularly deals with making changes to the website should have this password. If you are unaware who will have this password, please do send a request in via the support portal here. This is not your PIN or password to access the till or MStore Back Office.


  4. Once you have gained access to the website Back Office portal, click on View Config. If this options is not showing for you, please report this to support via the support portal by clicking here. Please use the Change Request category, and Configuration Change for the sub-category.
  5. Within the View Config page, you will then need to locate and update each of the below fields to what your email server is set to.

    You may want to make a backup of the existing settings, just in case you would like to revert these settings back. If you do not see any of these configuration options, please report this to support via the support portal here.

    • EMAILFROMADD - This is the email address used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from.
    • EMAILSERVER - This is the email exchange server used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website.
    • EMAILSERVERUID - This is the email exchange user account used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website.
    • EMAILSERVERPWD - This is the email exchange server password used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website.
    • EMAILSERVERPORT - This is the email exchange server port used for where configuration emails are sent (via a relay) from the website.
    • EMAILSERVERSSL - This is the email exchange server SSL flag used for where configuration emails are sent securely encrypted (via a relay) from the website.
          

  6. Once you have inserted the correct details, scroll to the bottom of the page, and press Update.


Testing 


You may then want to test sending an email to an email address, using these new details. To do this, please follow the below instructions:

  1. Click Back to go back to the website Back Office Admin menu.

  2. Click on Update Email Templates.
  3. Within Update Email Templates, click on Generic Email.

  4. Scroll to the bottom of this page. Then click Send Test. Type in a valid email address you would like to send this test email to, and click Send Email.


  5. a) If you receive "A confirmation email has been dispatched." at the top of the page, the recipient should then receive this test email within 30 minutes, and the testing is complete.


    b) If you receive "We're sorry, there has been an error sending your confirmation email please call to confirm booking", there is a problem with your email server details that you will need to double-check, along with the email account.

    If you require our assistance in troubleshooting the issue with your email server details, you can request this within our support portal by clicking here. Please use the Incident category, and Integration Issue for the sub-category. We will quote you for this work as this will be chargeable.

text: If you previously had PLU Upgrade rules setup online, but they are not firing all of a sudden. To have a look at this, please follow the below: In the Back Office, go to Setup. Go to PLU Upgrades. Within the Price History, you will be able to see all the PLU's price breaks that has been setup. Make sure there is a valid price for today, and into the future. Finally, you follow this Knowledge Base article to Update Website Templates To Refresh Changes From the Back Office.

text: It is possible to set up online tickets so that they cut off at a specific time each day. This configuration option will affect tickets and sessions online (by default sessions will vanish when they start, this can however be modified so they vanish at the end of the session) In the instance where you may want customers to be able to book for the morning but then prevent any sales later in the day a time can be specified where the current days tickets will be hidden from sale. Some sites have this set to 00:01 which then prevents bookings for the current day online. This can be configured within the website configuration. To access go to Booking Templates in back office and select 'Website Login' Login to the website configuration: (Password will have been provided to an administrator on site) Select 'View Config' Scroll through the list and find 'SAMEDAYCUTOFFTIME' (If it doesn't exist it can be added by clicking Add New Field) Put in the time you would like tickets to stop showing online and click Update. Tickets will then no longer show available online for the current day from the time specified.

In the instance where you may want customers to be able to book for the morning but then prevent any sales later in the day a time can be specified where the current days tickets will be hidden from sale.


Some sites have this set to 00:01 which then prevents bookings for the current day online. 


This can be configured within the website configuration. To access go to Booking Templates in back office and select 'Website Login'



Login to the website configuration:



(Password will have been provided to an administrator on site)



Select 'View Config'



Scroll through the list and find 'SAMEDAYCUTOFFTIME'

Tickets will then no longer show available online for the current day from the time specified.

text: If you are getting online bookings/purchases, where customers are reporting they did not receive payment confirmation on their booking/purchases or transaction failed is stated, but the money for this had been taken out of the customers bank account, then this is due to our web server not receiving a confirmation that the customer could have successfully paid. The MStore website has to pass customers to your online payment provider to take the payment. The payment is then processed on your payment providers site, and they send us a response containing whether the payment was successful, failed or declined. If payment is taken, but no booking is logged in MStore, our system has not received a response from the payment provider within an appropriate time. There can be any number of reasons for this to occur, including Network errors between the provider and our website Error with the provider PC/Internet browser crashing Power cut Abandoned transactions. Delay in this response being sent to our system. Unfortunately, it is impossible to catch data that we have not received If we do not receive this from your payment provider in 1-2 hours+, this booking will be automatically set to a cancelled reservation, to release the availability for another customer to book. Otherwise most availability would be filled from abandoned transactions of customers selecting tickets, but not successfully paying for them.
title: Failed Bookings/Purchases On MStore, But Money Taken From Customers Bank Accounts
description:
If you are getting online bookings/purchases, where customers are reporting they did not receive payment confirmation on their booking/purchases or transaction failed is stated, but the money for this had been taken out of the customers bank account, then this is due to our web server not receiving a confirmation that the customer could have successfully paid.


The MStore website has to pass customers to your online payment provider to take the payment. The payment is then processed on your payment providers site, and they send us a response containing whether the payment was successful, failed or declined.


If payment is taken, but no booking is logged in MStore, our system has not received a response from the payment provider within an appropriate time. There can be any number of reasons for this to occur, including

  • Network errors between the provider and our website
  • Error with the provider
  • PC/Internet browser crashing
  • Power cut
  • Abandoned transactions.
  • Delay in this response being sent to our system.


Unfortunately, it is impossible to catch data that we have not received If we do not receive this from your payment provider in 1-2 hours+, this booking will be automatically set to a cancelled reservation, to release the availability for another customer to book. Otherwise most availability would be filled from abandoned transactions of customers selecting tickets, but not successfully paying for them.

text: Mstore expects a payment response to be received back from the payment provider within an hour window. The reason for this is down to online availability. This can be extended by request however this will then have a knock on effect on any session / ticket availability as the system will not clear down the reserved bookings after an hour. While the system is waiting on a payment response any bookings created will be placed into a 'reserved' status. After an hour the system will then automatically mark the booking as 'Cancelled'. If a payment is received after this point the booking will NOT be updated automatically and will require the booking status to be updated manually. Troubleshooting: Once a payment request has been sent to the payment provider K3 no longer have any control over the transaction. The system will wait for a payment response. If there are any problems encountered payment provider end this will need to be taken up with your payment provider. Most payment providers have an online portal to track payments, this will also show any pending payments.
title: Online payment received late - Booking status not updated
description:

The reason for this is down to online availability. This can be extended by request however this will then have a knock on effect on any session / ticket availability as the system will not clear down the reserved bookings after an hour. 


While the system is waiting on a payment response any bookings created will be placed into a 'reserved' status. 


After an hour the system will then automatically mark the booking as 'Cancelled'. 


If a payment is received after this point the booking will NOT be updated automatically and will require the booking status to be updated manually. 


Troubleshooting:


Once a payment request has been sent to the payment provider K3 no longer have any control over the transaction. The system will wait for a payment response. If there are any problems encountered payment provider end this will need to be taken up with your payment provider. 


Most payment providers have an online portal to track payments, this will also show any pending payments.

text: Issue If you are experiencing where your booking confirmation email custom header image keeps reverting to another image, this can be due to the way the system is setup to work. When you upload a new image to a booking confirmation email template, the system saves this image, and then the booking confirmation email template references this image via its name. If you then upload a different image with the same name, this image won't be saved as the original image cannot be overwritten. So the original image will continue to show when you view the page again. Solution To overcome this, we recommend to give each new booking confirmation email template custom header image a different name to prevent this from occurring.
title: Booking Confirmation Email Template Custom Header Image Reverting
description:
Issue

If you are experiencing where your booking confirmation email custom header image keeps reverting to another image, this can be due to the way the system is setup to work.


When you upload a new image to a booking confirmation email template, the system saves this image, and then the booking confirmation email template references this image via its name.


If you then upload a different image with the same name, this image won't be saved as the original image cannot be overwritten. So the original image will continue to show when you view the page again.


Solution

To overcome this, we recommend to give each new booking confirmation email template custom header image a different  name to prevent this from occurring.

text: If you would like to discount PLU Group items on your website, you will need to setup an Internet Voucher that is Basket Reducing, with a Refund Resource set. This will add a separate line in the basket when recalling the booking, that involves the discount. This is because when the PLU Group item is recalled on the till, the price will always be recalculated to the value of the Group PLU's, even if the PLU was discounted online. However, this will discount the whole online basket, whether by percentage or value of reduction. text: TABLE OF CONTENTS What is a CAPTCHA? MStore Ticketing and ReCaptcha A Note About Gateways What is a CAPTCHA? A CAPTCHA test is designed to determine if an online user is really a human and not a bot. CAPTCHA is an acronym that stands for "Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart." Users often encounter CAPTCHA and reCAPTCHA tests on the Internet when submitting contact forms, logins and checkouts, to ensure the person submitting the form is a real person. Such tests are one way of managing bot activity, although the approach has its drawbacks. Although CAPTCHAs are designed to block automated bots, CAPTCHAs are themselves automated. They're programmed to pop up in certain places on a website, and they automatically pass or fail users. CAPTCHAs can be user interactive or fully automated. Fully automated/invisible CAPTCHAs use the providers intelligence to determine if the entity browsing a page is real. it bases this on IP address, browser type, and various other HTTP header type of information. This, along with taking a holistic look at a user's behaviour and history of interacting with content on the Internet helps to determine the likelihood of being a bot. Most of the time, the program can decide based on those factors whether or not the user is a bot, without providing the user with a challenge to complete. If not, then the user will get a typical reCAPTCHA challenge. Some examples of a visible CAPTCHA are below. Note: Bots themselves are not necessarily harmful. Google and other search engines use bots to trawl web pages for search purposes. However, not all bots are as pleasant and some are used for nefarious purposes ReCaptcha is a free service offered by Google to allow websites to utilise a CAPTCHA on their own websites, and does require code implementation at the point a site wants to check the authenticity of a user. CAPTCHAs are not foolproof. They are simply one way of helping to reduce the risk of bot attacks. Several hundreds of thousands of pounds can be spent on cybersecurity and bots can still get around it. So it is a rick/reward scenario when considering the use of a CAPTCHA. MStore Ticketing and ReCaptcha We have added support for Google ReCaptcha's Invisible captcha into our core product for new websites, but does require implementation on to existing sites, and will require a conversation with your success manager for this to be enabled. Our ReCaptcha implementation is designed to check the authenticity of the user immediately before forwarding them to the payment gateway. It happens when the user clicks on the Pay Now button. This is designed to reduce the bot traffic to any potential payment gateway. Our implementation allows you to fine tune how "aggressive" the ReCaptcha is in deciding if a transaction is a human or bot as shown below. The setting is highlighted below in the website config which you can access on your online portal. Note that the GoogleCaptchaSilentMode allows activity logging to be done without actually having any Captcha process stop/allow transactions. If the CAPTCHA check fails, they do not reach the payment gateway. There will be a visible indicator on this page to tell them it has failed, and it is impossible for a failed CAPTCHA to reach the Gateway. Some human interaction may be interpreted by Google's ReCaptcha due to settings the user has on cookies, using Incognito mode etc A Note About Gateways Payment gateways typically utilise their own threat detection systems, including CAPTCHA systems. If the user is getting a CAPTCHA fail on the Payment Gateway, it is not something we can manage or control.
title: MStore and ReCaptcha
description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • What is a CAPTCHA?
  • MStore Ticketing and ReCaptcha
  • A Note About Gateways


What is a CAPTCHA?


A CAPTCHA test is designed to determine if an online user is really a human and not a bot. CAPTCHA is an acronym that stands for "Completely Automated Public Turing test to tell Computers and Humans Apart." Users often encounter CAPTCHA and reCAPTCHA tests on the Internet when submitting contact forms, logins and checkouts, to ensure the person submitting the form is a real person. Such tests are one way of managing bot activity, although the approach has its drawbacks.


Although CAPTCHAs are designed to block automated bots, CAPTCHAs are themselves automated. They're programmed to pop up in certain places on a website, and they automatically pass or fail users.


CAPTCHAs can be user interactive or fully automated. Fully automated/invisible CAPTCHAs use the providers intelligence to determine if the entity browsing a page is real. it bases this on IP address, browser type, and various other HTTP header type of information. This, along with taking a holistic look at a user's behaviour and history of interacting with content on the Internet helps to determine the likelihood of being a bot. Most of the time, the program can decide based on those factors whether or not the user is a bot, without providing the user with a challenge to complete. If not, then the user will get a typical reCAPTCHA challenge. 


Some examples of a visible CAPTCHA are below.


Note:  Bots themselves are not necessarily harmful. Google and other search engines use bots to trawl web pages for search purposes. However, not all bots are as pleasant and some are used for nefarious purposes


ReCaptcha is a free service offered by Google to allow websites to utilise a CAPTCHA on their own websites, and does require code implementation at the point a site wants to check the authenticity of a user.


CAPTCHAs are not foolproof. They are simply one way of helping to reduce the risk of bot attacks. Several hundreds of thousands of pounds can be spent on cybersecurity and bots can still get around it. So it is a rick/reward scenario when considering the use of a CAPTCHA.


MStore Ticketing and ReCaptcha

We have added support for Google ReCaptcha's Invisible captcha into our core product for new websites, but does require implementation on to existing sites, and will require a conversation with your success manager for this to be enabled.


Our ReCaptcha implementation is designed to check the authenticity of the user immediately before forwarding them to the payment gateway. It happens when the user clicks on the Pay Now button. This is designed to reduce the bot traffic to any potential payment gateway.


Our implementation allows you to fine tune how "aggressive" the ReCaptcha is in deciding if a transaction is a human or bot as shown below. The setting is highlighted below in the website config which you can access on your online portal.




Note that the GoogleCaptchaSilentMode allows activity logging to be done without actually having any Captcha process stop/allow transactions.



If the CAPTCHA check fails, they do not reach the payment gateway. There will be a visible indicator on this page to tell them it has failed, and it is impossible for a failed CAPTCHA to reach the Gateway.


Some human interaction may be interpreted by Google's ReCaptcha due to settings the user has on cookies, using Incognito mode etc



A Note About Gateways

Payment gateways typically utilise their own threat detection systems, including CAPTCHA systems.


If the user is getting a CAPTCHA fail on the Payment Gateway, it is not something we can manage or control.

text: Historically, when K3 have developed customer ticketing sites to be inline with the customer's general website, we have referenced the customer's own Cascading Style Sheets (CSS) files, hosted on their own servers. This brought benefits such as customers being able to control their stylesheets, which will downstream to our ticketing site... B U T The K3 ticketing site depends on certain CSS content being in a certain format, which means that customers can, inadvertently, break their ticketing site when making changes to their main website. This causes a huge amount of pain for all involved with potential loss of ticketing revenue for K3's customers, and recently these issues have become more frequent. Policy to eliminate ticketing downtime from website styling changes K3 will host a copy of the customer's CSS on our site (as well as customers hosting their own copy on their main website) Impact The ticketing website will not be broken by main website styling changes. Any changes customers want to do to their own website will need to be sent to K3 to be applied to the ticketing site as well This means that, if customers want to make changes to their website styling, you will need to raise a change request through your CSM or Support. We will take a copy of your CSS, apply it, test it, and deploy it with your signoff. This will be a small chargeable consulting project. This policy change will be rolled out as and when required unless you would like to request it's done now. If any of the following apply, this is the point when we will switch from referring to the main website CSS to hosting a copy on the ticketing website: Website Reskin. Mini website reskin where navigation and or simple styling changes are done. Upgrading website technology (to the newer "bootstrap" version). This is a simple, proactive solution to prevent ticket purchases being unavailable due to an unexpected change to the main website styling.

 B U T


The K3 ticketing site depends on certain CSS content being in a certain format, which means that customers can, inadvertently, break their ticketing site when making changes to their main website. Policy to eliminate ticketing downtime from website styling changes

Impact

text: Please note: If you have never used this functionality before, this may need to be setup for your site, which might be chargeable if you do not have the required modules. How do I upload images to my shop website? If you would like to upload images for a shop item, open the PLU maintenance screen for this record, make sure Sell item on the Internet? (1) is ticked. text: This Knowledge Base article will explain how the system deals with online abandoned baskets, to prevent booking/session allocation being held by these bookings, to be available for willing customers. At the time the customer the customer has inserted all their booking details and click Pay Now, all their bookings details gets sent to your MStore database, saved as an online reservation, awaiting confirmation on a successful payment from your online payment provider. However, we have no control once we pass the customer to your online payment provider and may never receive a confirmation from your online payment provider if the customer does not proceed with payment. Therefore, there has to be a set period of time before changing the customers booking to a cancelled reservation. Our system runs a process to cancel any online booking older than an hour (default) without payment confirmation, which can be adjusted. This is run every hour, which can mean bookings may not cancel until between 60-120 minutes after clicking Pay Now. This is a reasonable amount of time to give customers time to pay for their booking (as they may need to find and attempt paying with multiple cards), without receiving payments after the booking has been cancelled, which must be avoided at all costs. This is because this will not resurrect the customers booking, and all seats the customer booked will be available again, potentially making a customer customer believe of having a booking, when they do not. Some payment providers give customers 20 minutes to pay once customers are passed to their portal. So you may have some customisation at the online payment providers end to help with issues relating to this.

text: Issue If you are selling an item or redeeming a booking, and you receive the below message. This means the item you are selling does not have a valid price for today, or the day you have chosen to sell this on. Resolution To resolve this issue: Find the item within Price Lookup Index in the MStore Back Office. Open the PLU Maintenance screen for this item (A quick giveaway for the cause can be due to the Current List Price showing as No Valid Price). Click View/Add Price. Within the Price History screen, make sure there is a valid price showing for today, or the date you are trying to sell this item for. We recommend adding 10 years on most PLU's to reduce how common this issue occurs. Do not allow price breaks valid from and to dates to overlap, as this can cause adverse issues Click Apply. Recreate till data (Instructions on this can be found here: How To Recreate Till Data In MStore Back Office), and update the tills affected. When you next open the till program, you can now sell this item.
title: Item Has No Valid Price When Selling Item Or Redeeming Booking
description:
Issue

If you are selling an item or redeeming a booking, and you receive the below message. This means the item you are selling does not have a valid price for today, or the day you have chosen to sell this on.



Resolution

To resolve this issue:

  1. Find the item within Price Lookup Index in the MStore Back Office.
  2. Open the PLU Maintenance screen for this item (A quick giveaway for the cause can be due to the Current List Price showing as No Valid Price).
  3. Click View/Add Price.
  4. Within the Price History screen, make sure there is a valid price showing for today, or the date you are trying to sell this item for. We recommend adding 10 years on most PLU's to reduce how common this issue occurs.

    Do not allow price breaks valid from and to dates to overlap, as this can cause adverse issues
  5. Click Apply.
  6. Recreate till data (Instructions on this can be found here: How To Recreate Till Data In MStore Back Office), and update the tills affected.

When you next open the till program, you can now sell this item.
