text: If you would like to change how your receipts print, you can change this in the MStore Back Office by following the below instructions: Click on Setup, Till Configuration. Select your till in the drop-down (3). Choose one of the following options to change when receipts print (4): Don't Print - Do not print any receipts when completing a transaction. Print - Always print a receipts when completing a transaction. Prompt to Print - Prompt the till operator whether to print a receipt when completing a transaction. Print But Not Zero - Only print a receipt if the value of the transaction does not equal £0. Prompt to Email - Prompt the till operator to send this receipt to the requested email address (This will require chargeable setup before this functionality can be used. Please enquire with your account manager if you would like more information on this). Click Apply and Close. Finally, recreate till data to push the update down to the till. To understand how to do this, please follow this Knowledge Base article: How To Recreate Till Data In MStore Back Office.
title: How To Change When Your Receipts Print In POS
description:
If you would like to change how your receipts print, you can change this in the MStore Back Office by following the below instructions:


  1. Click on Setup, Till Configuration.
     
  2. Select your till in the drop-down (3).
  3. Choose one of the following options to change when receipts print (4):
    • Don't Print - Do not print any receipts when completing a transaction.
    • Print - Always print a receipts when completing a transaction.
    • Prompt to Print - Prompt the till operator whether to print a receipt when completing a transaction.
    • Print But Not Zero - Only print a receipt if the value of the transaction does not equal £0.
    • Prompt to Email - Prompt the till operator to send this receipt to the requested email address (This will require chargeable setup before this functionality can be used. Please enquire with your account manager if you would like more information on this).
  4. Click Apply and Close.
     
  5. Finally, recreate till data to push the update down to the till. To understand how to do this, please follow this Knowledge Base article: How To Recreate Till Data In MStore Back Office.

text: After performing a transaction in version 3.14 of the MStore POS software, and you receive the below message, please follow the below instructions. First, go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac and right-click on PMStore.exe. Click on Properties in the contextual menu. Within Properties, click on the Compatibility tab make sure Compatibility mode is ticked and set to Windows 7, and tick Run this program as an administrator. Click Apply and OK. Right-click on PMStorePOS.exe in the same folder location. Click on Properties, then Compatibility tab. Set Compatibility mode to Windows 7 only. Click Apply and OK. If there is still an issue, have a look at replacing the C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\PServerUpdate.exe with a known working version from another till.
title: "The Server Update Process Has Stopped - OK To Restart It?" When Performing Transactions On Till On 3.14
description:
After performing a transaction in version 3.14 of the MStore POS software, and you receive the below message, please follow the below instructions.



  1. First, go to C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac and right-click on PMStore.exe. 
  2. Click on Properties in the contextual menu. 
  3. Within Properties, click on the Compatibility tab make sure Compatibility mode is ticked and set to Windows 7, and tick Run this program as an administrator. 
  4. Click Apply and OK.
  5. Right-click on PMStorePOS.exe in the same folder location.
  6. Click on Properties, then Compatibility tab.
  7.  Set Compatibility mode to Windows 7 only.
  8. Click Apply and OK.


If there is still an issue, have a look at replacing the C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac\PServerUpdate.exe with a known working version from another till.

text: The Return Visit Search functionality can be used to find, view, edit, cancel and reprint return visit tickets. You can search for return visits using their name, postcode or email, as you can see below, and then select the return visit in the list. Please note, you cannot redeem Return visits directly from the Return Visit search screen when you select OK on the selected return visit. You will need to reprint the return visit ticket, and scan this in, which is explained further down this article. Once you have searched and selected the return visit in question with the up and down arrows to the right of the screen, you can click Edit to view the details of the selected return visit. From here, you can view, edit, cancel and reprint the return visit. Reprinting the ticket will allow you to redeem the return visit by scanning the barcode on the ticket into the basket on the till program. Please note, when you redeem return visits, nothing will populate in the customer/account section of the till program, as return visits are not a customer account. text: Occasionally, the MeracUpdater may stop running on the till. When this happens, transactions will not update to the database, causing the till to malfunction and transactions to remain stuck. text: In order for PLU upgrades to fire at the POS, all qualifying memberships must be created using the membership wizard. Selecting the individual PLU's into the basket will not cause the upgrade to fire. Further, all qualifying memberships must be completed using the one wizard as shown below. After completing the first membership enter / swipe the next card and complete the next one. Do this until qualifying memberships have been entered. The complete the wizard. Completing a separate wizard for each membership will not fire the PLU upgrade. When all qualifying memberships are entered into the wizard and finish is selected the upgrade price (and its PLU) will be shown. Once complete the PLU will be sent to the basket.

text: In a nutshell, if your MStore version is up to date (not more than 12 months old), you will get the best user experience, and full support. TABLE OF CONTENTS Version Lifecycle Are There any Upgrade Costs? How to Request an Upgrade Version Lifecycle The general version support policy is that customers should be using a release that is less than 12 months old (i.e. it's less than one year after the release date documented in the MStore Release Notes). The benefits of this are: You can take advantage of new features. Have fixes for faults found by our software development and testing team, and by other customers (which you may not experience, or may not know you've experienced). Performance and/or usability may be enhanced. The latest MStore version will be tested on the latest supported versions and service packs of the Windows Operating System (see What Operating Systems is the MStore Back Office Supported On? ) Note that if your server is not not compatible with the above, K3 can host your MStore server in our cloud if you do not want to upgrade your operating system and hardware. Unless in exceptional circumstances, we do not apply patches to existing versions, we fix in the latest version and upgrade you to that version. There are some elements of MStore such as the website, reports or database code/fixes which may be updated separately to fix an issue without an MStore back office and POS upgrade. If your version is older than 12 months, we will only provide support for confirmed P1 and P2 Incidents in the core MStore POS and database/backend software (which may still require an upgrade to fix). All support requests which are not related to a possible fault or superseded functionality in the out of date core software will still be dealt with as normal. Are There any Upgrade Costs? There is no charge for the upgraded software when you have a current subscription (except chargeable modules which you have not previously purchased). Effort required from K3 to do an upgrade The effort required to upgrade your system to fix significant faults you have experienced is free of charge as long as it's during normal business hours (9-5:30 weekdays excluding public holidays). Your subscription also entitles you to one free functional upgrade per year during normal business hours (e.g. if you want to take advantage of new features and/or make sure that your version is no more than 12 months old). The time spent installing an upgrade is chargeable if it's required to be done out of normal business hours (agreed upon request), or if more than one functional upgrade is requested in a year. An upgrade typically takes 1-2 hours, but varies according to complexity and size of you system architecture. How to Request an Upgrade If you're not sure what version you have, please see How to check what version of MStore you are using. Please raise a service request on the support portal as shown in the example below. The upgrade steps can be found in MStore Core System Upgrade Process which describes what customers and K3 need to do.
title: What versions of MStore are supported?
description:
In a nutshell, if your MStore version is up to date (not more than 12 months old), you will get the best user experience, and full support.



TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • Version Lifecycle
  • Are There any Upgrade Costs?
  • How to Request an Upgrade


Version Lifecycle

The general version support policy is that customers should be using a release that is less than 12 months old (i.e. it's less than one year after the release date documented in the MStore Release Notes).


The benefits of this are:

  • You can take advantage of new features.
  • Have fixes for faults found by our software development and testing team, and by other customers (which you may not experience, or may not know you've experienced).
  • Performance and/or usability may be enhanced.
  • The latest MStore version will be tested on the latest supported versions and service packs of the Windows Operating System (see What Operating Systems is the MStore Back Office Supported On? )
    • Note that if your server is not not compatible with the above, K3 can host your MStore server in our cloud if you do not want to upgrade your operating system and hardware.


Unless in exceptional circumstances, we do not apply patches to existing versions, we fix in the latest version and upgrade you to that version. There are some elements of MStore such as the website, reports or database code/fixes which may be updated separately to fix an issue without an MStore back office and POS upgrade.


If your version is older than 12 months, we will only provide support for confirmed P1 and P2 Incidents in the core MStore POS and database/backend software (which may still require an upgrade to fix).

All support requests which are not related to a possible fault or superseded functionality in the out of date core software will still be dealt with as normal.



Are There any Upgrade Costs?

There is no charge for the upgraded software when you have a current subscription (except chargeable modules which you have not previously purchased).


Effort required from K3 to do an upgrade

  • The effort required to upgrade your system to fix significant faults you have experienced is free of charge as long as it's during normal business hours (9-5:30 weekdays excluding public holidays).
  • Your subscription also entitles you to one free functional upgrade per year during normal business hours (e.g. if you want to take advantage of new features and/or make sure that your version is no more than 12 months old).

 

The time spent installing an upgrade is chargeable if it's required to be done out of normal business hours (agreed upon request), or if more than one functional upgrade is requested in a year. An upgrade typically takes 1-2 hours, but varies according to complexity and size of you system architecture.


How to Request an Upgrade

If you're not sure what version you have, please see How to check what version of MStore you are using.


Please raise a service request on the support portal as shown in the example below.




The upgrade steps can be found in MStore Core System Upgrade Process which describes what customers and K3 need to do.

text: The general upgrade policy and lifecycle for MStore can be found on What versions of MStore are supported? including what triggers an upgrade to be done. The "MStore Core System" refers to the MStore database, Back Office, and Till/POS programs. Overview We will schedule a day and time with you to do the upgrade which needs to be when you do not need to use the POS/tills. If there is not already a support ticket for this, we will raise one to capture all communications regarding the upgrade. The upgrade is done on the MStore database server first, and then all tills and PCs pull down the update when they are restarted. If there are any tills online, we will connect onto a couple to make sure that the new version has been installed correctly. We will then let you check and confirm that the others have been updated successfully. Server Upgrade The database server upgrade is done first, and is carried out by K3 who will: Log onto your database server using Team Viewer. Take a backup of your database. Running a database upgrade script (which, as applicable, will add and change stored procedures, amend or add additional tables and fields as needed. Copy across new files to be "blobbed" into the database and authorised via MStore to send to tills and computers running our software. Recreate the till data file, so the latest data and files are sent to all the tills when they restart. Back Office and Till Upgrade How to Trigger the Upgrade Once the server upgrade is complete, the upgrade on all tills and machines running the MStore Back Office can be triggered in any of the following ways: Restart the machine (preferred/safest method). Note that tablets will need to be powered off and on again (usually by pressing and holding the power button - just a single press puts the table into standby mode and does not restart it) Restart the Windows Service "MeracUpdater" For tills, you can click on this button Technical Details There is a windows service called "MeracUpdater" that runs on start-up. This detects if there is a newer version and if so applies this to the computer. The update normally takes 20-30 seconds and will likely already happened by the time a computer boots up and is ready to use. There is no reason to keep computers on to receive the update. Leaving one or two tills allow us to make sure those specific tills do update when we try the above. There are 3 things that could prevent the update. During the original installation of the MStore software, full permissions will have been set over the path "C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac" for all users. If this isn’t set then it will prevent the software being overwritten with newer files. The MStore software has been left open. You can’t overwrite a file if it is open. Computers being restarted prevents this. The computer is running the wrong version of the updater process (unlikely). If any computers fail to update, we recommend a reboot. If the update has still not been downloaded, please let K3 Support know, as they will need to dial into the affected computer and check the setup and fix. Rollback In the rare circumstances when an upgrade does not work as expected, the rollback process is very dependent on the situation, but the general process is as follows: K3 will investigate the cause to find out if it's setup/data-related, giving a workaround if possible. In agreement with you, we would generally allow a maximum of 1 hour before moving to the next step if the issue is preventing trading. K3 to reinstall the previous version of the software as a temporary measure via the same process above, where we deem this to be a program issue. Therefore restarting tills/PCs will pull down the desired version. K3 will use the previous database backup to refer back to and help investigate issues that had occurred between your previous version and the latest version. Once the rollback is complete, we would work as top priority to find the cause of the issue and provide a fix.
title: MStore Core System Upgrade Process
description:
The general upgrade policy and lifecycle for MStore can be found on What versions of MStore are supported? including what triggers an upgrade to be done.


The "MStore Core System" refers to the MStore database, Back Office, and Till/POS programs.


Overview

We will schedule a day and time with you to do the upgrade which needs to be when you do not need to use the POS/tills. If there is not already a support ticket for this, we will raise one to capture all communications regarding the upgrade.


The upgrade is done on the MStore database server first, and then all tills and PCs pull down the update when they are restarted. 


If there are any tills online, we will connect onto a couple to make sure that the new version has been installed correctly. We will then let you check and confirm that the others have been updated successfully.


Server Upgrade

The database server upgrade is done first, and is carried out by K3 who will:

  1. Log onto your database server using Team Viewer.
  2. Take a backup of your database.
  3. Running a database upgrade script (which, as applicable, will add and change stored procedures, amend or add additional tables and fields as needed.
  4. Copy across new files to be "blobbed" into the database and authorised via MStore to send to tills and computers running our software.
  5. Recreate the till data file, so the latest data and files are sent to all the tills when they restart.


Back Office and Till Upgrade

How to Trigger the Upgrade

Once the server upgrade is complete, the upgrade on all tills and machines running the MStore Back Office can be triggered in any of the following ways:

  1. Restart the machine (preferred/safest method).
    Note that tablets will need to be powered off and on again (usually by pressing and holding the power button - just a single press puts the table into standby mode and does not restart it)
  2. Restart the Windows Service "MeracUpdater"
  3. For tills, you can click on this button


Technical Details

There is a windows service called "MeracUpdater" that runs on start-up. This detects if there is a newer version and if so applies this to the computer. The update normally takes 20-30 seconds and will likely already happened by the time a computer boots up and is ready to use. There is no reason to keep computers on to receive the update. Leaving one or two tills allow us to make sure those specific tills do update when we try the above. There are 3 things that could prevent the update.

  1. During the original installation of the MStore software, full permissions will have been set over the path "C:\Program Files (x86)\Merac" for all users. If this isn’t set then it will prevent the software being overwritten with newer files.
  2. The MStore software has been left open. You can’t overwrite a file if it is open. Computers being restarted prevents this.
  3. The computer is running the wrong version of the updater process (unlikely).

If any computers fail to update, we recommend a reboot. If the update has still not been downloaded, please let K3 Support know, as they will need to dial into the affected computer and check the setup and fix.


Rollback

In the rare circumstances when an upgrade does not work as expected, the rollback process is very dependent on the situation, but the general process is as follows:

  1. K3 will investigate the cause to find out if it's setup/data-related, giving a workaround if possible. In agreement with you, we would generally allow a maximum of 1 hour before moving to the next step if the issue is preventing trading.
  2. K3 to reinstall the previous version of the software as a temporary measure via the same process above, where we deem this to be a program issue. Therefore restarting tills/PCs will pull down the desired version.
  3. K3 will use the previous database backup to refer back to and help investigate issues that had occurred between your previous version and the latest version.


Once the rollback is complete, we would work as top priority to find the cause of the issue and provide a fix.

text: K3 hosts many customers' databases, but if you host your own database, here are some tips on databases maintenance best practices which will help to make sure that you don't experience performance issues (e.g. slow reports) caused by a lack of database maintenance. MStore uses Microsoft SQL Server for it’s database which is a transactional database with a lot of data is written to it and updated on it. To prevent issues when retrieving data it is very important to keep the database healthy using a scheduled maintenance plan in SQL server. The following points are advised to address this: Perform data integrity checks Regularly checking the consistency of your databases helps ensure data integrity. SQL Server provides commands such as DBCC CHECKDB to detect and repair integrity issues in the database. Maintain indexes Indexes are crucial for query performance. Over time, indexes can become fragmented, leading to decreased performance. SQL Server provides maintenance tasks such as rebuilding or reorganizing indexes to optimize their performance. Regular index maintenance should be scheduled to keep your database running efficiently. Update statistics SQL Server uses statistics to generate optimal query execution plans. Outdated or inaccurate statistics can lead to suboptimal query performance. SQL Server automatically updates statistics, but in some cases, manual updates may be necessary, especially on large tables or after significant data changes. Monitor disk space and clean up data Monitoring disk space is critical to prevent data loss and maintain database performance. Regularly check disk space usage on the server hosting your SQL Server databases and ensure that you have adequate space for backup files, transaction logs and database growth. Implement data archiving and cleanup processes to remove obsolete or unnecessary data from databases. Restrict Memory Usage You might want to limit the amount of memory which SQL Server uses on a machine because if it's allowed to use all memory, this can have adverse effects. Back up databases and transaction logs It’s important to take regular backups and test them periodically. Be sure to follow retention policies for backup files. Is your Database on a Fit-For-Purpose Server? If the above tips do not solve the issue, please check if your server is up to date enough (i.e .not more than 5 years old), and is it hosting anything else? Is your server running one of the supported versions of Windows - see What Operating Systems is the MStore Back Office Supported On? Do you need help with this? If this all seems too technical and you need help, we can host your database for you, but we can also remotely manage your database running on your own server. For more information on hosting, please contact your customer success manager. For more information on K3 helping you manage your database, please see the options in K3 MStore Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan.

description:
TABLE OF CONTENTS

  • What is Database Optimisation?
    • Why Optimise Your K3 Application Database?

What is Database Optimisation?

Database optimisation is the process of using various database manufacturer tools to fine tune their efficiency and maximise the speed at which it works. The tools need configuring, monitoring, and the results evaluated to achieve this.

 

Why Optimise Your K3 Application Database?

In a dynamic business landscape, ensuring fast and reliable application responses from your database infrastructure is paramount. K3 applications have a database to store information such as transactions, customer records, configuration and much more. If you have a database which is not performing very well, you may find that responses in the application are slow, or even time-out, preventing you from running your business effectively. This is easily avoided if you have the right technical procedures in place to ensure this doesn’t happen.

 

Who Is Responsible? 

K3 offer a cloud hosted database service, but if you are hosting the database on your own infrastructure, then your IT team are responsible for its maintenance. We provide guidance for some products on how your IT Team can keep the database in the best condition (see this article for logged-in users), but if your team does not include database experts, then for a minimal cost we can help you avoid costly issues with availability and performance of your database.

 

How Can K3 Help?

K3’s Experts

We have product and databases experts ready to provide assurance that your database is performing the best it can on your server. These experts already manage our cloud database hosting service for customers, and so have the product and database technical experience to know what’s best for your application database. Importantly, they know how to tune, but then also maintain that state of tune as your database grows and changes over time.

 

Steps to an Optimised Database

The fixed price Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan consist of the stages below.

Initialisation

  1. Perform diagnostic checks on the database and run tools to optimise it
         We will also recommend any changes you might need to make on your server (e.g. if it does not have enough space or memory).
  2. Validate your Backup Regime Meet Requirements
         K3 are not responsible for your database backups, but we can make sure it is being backed up to the local server for your own tools to copy off the server, and advise if you need to implement anything additional.
  3. Configure and schedule a regular maintenance plan
         The optimisation tasks will run weekly outside of the hours your business is open.

Monitoring and Verification

  1. Alerts will be configured from your database to email K3 Support directly
         If there are issues reported by the database, Support will act upon those tickets from the email quickly which will be raised as a Priority 2 by default.
  2. Monthly Inspection
         Once a month, we will log on to your server and inspect it manually to make sure all optimisation routines are as expected, and that they are having an effect. You will be provided with a brief report giving you the assurance that everything is OK.

Annual Health Check

At the beginning of each subsequent year since the plan commenced, the same diagnostic steps will be performed as the Initialisation phase which includes recommendations which might have changed due to any changes on the server (some servers host more than the K3 product database, so there are many variables).

What Happens if there’s a Problem?

The Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan is provided on a fixed price basis per database. If any of the checks find an issue that we need to spend time investigating and resolving, then we will do this on a time and materials basis at the applicable standard rate. An example of this work would be if the database has grown too large and you would like us to archive some data.

Additional Options

The following can optionally be added to the Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan

Database Backups

Ensuring your data is backed up in the case of a major incident is essential in any business continuity plan. We will give you the comfort of knowing that backups are being created successfully (at a schedule you define - e.g. every night) which will include making sure that they are the expected size, location, and number of old versions kept.

Frequency: Checking backups would be part of the monthly Monitoring and Verification stage described previously.

Disaster Recovery Testing

If you have subscribed to the optional extra of verifying that database backups are being created, you can also add on that we will do a Disaster Recovery test. This takes your assurance that you are ready for anything to the next level by taking your most recent backup, connecting it to the K3 back office and till programs, and ensuring the integrity of the database backup.

Frequency: This can be done as often as required by the customer – we would recommend at least every 6 months.

Archiving

If you would like to regularly archive your data, we can add this to the Database Optimisation and Maintenance Plan. Sometimes a database can grow so large that it impacts performance, even if all the other industry standard maintenance actions are taking place. Data that can be archived includes dormant customers, and transactions older than a certain number of years.

The archived data is kept in a separate database for you to backup and keep.

Frequency: This can be done as often as required by the customer. We would perform analysis on the database first and provide a recommendation.

 

Next Steps

Contact your K3 Customer Success Manager to discuss what best fits your needs, and how we can work together to give you optimum performance and business continuity.

Download our brochure if you would like to discuss this with your team.

description:
What does recreate till data do?

In order to send updates that have been made in the Back Office and training tills, you will need to recreate till data, so these updates can be pushed down to the tills.


How to recreate till data?

From the Home or Setup screen, click Edit, in the top-left screen. Then Recreate Till Data.

 

From this screen, you can then click Apply, to recreate till data for all till. If you want to only recreate till data for specific tills or departments, you will want to right-click on the tick next to All Departments, which will prevent all departments from updating.


You can then right-click on the cross again the department you would like to recreate till data for, or click the plus to drill down into the sub-department and then again to the list of tills within that sub-department. Here, you can right-click on the cross next to the till to recreate till data for that till.



Once you are happy with your selection and have clicked Apply, allow around thirty seconds for the recreate till data process to complete. At which point, you will get the below message appear.



The final step in order the till to take this update is to log out of the till program, and then click Update System on the 4-button program. You may then log back into the Point Of Sale with the updates.

text: If you get the below error message, it is down to the membership setup. The minimum join date allowed by the database is 01st Jan 1899 (this is a restriction within Microsoft Windows I believe), the max expiry date allowed by the system is 31 Dec 2099. Back office will only show Jan 01st 2000 to 31st Dec 2099. Within the membership setup, if you set it to anything over 200 years (200 years works as that is 1899) you will get this error. Solution: Set the membership duration to match the valid to and from date length. In this case 99 years.

text: If you carry out a Stock Adjustment (via Setup > Stock > Stock Adjustments) and then someone checks the stock holding quantity of that stock item (for the specific 'Stock Location') and it did not change, it is most likely due to a setting on the relevant 'Stock Item'. Go into Setup > Stock > Stock Index and search for the relevant Stock Item in the usual way, then double click the stock item in question. This will show the 'Stock Maintenance' screen (see below example) for this 'Stock Item'. If stock movements are not being recorded for this 'Stock Item', it is likely that the tick box to the right of the text 'Track Qty:' is unticked. Click in the box so that it becomes ticked. The 'Save' button at the bottom of this screen can now be clicked to save the changes. This should now resolve the issue where the stock levels were not being deducted when a 'Stock Adjustment' was processed for this 'Stock Item'.

text: Inability to change a session booking time when not changing the date. Unable to move the booking to a different time on the same day. e.g. Our Father Christmas train have multiple sessions on one day. If we want to move a booking from one DAY to another DAY then the 'Move booking' button works fine. But if we want to change the time but not the date of the booking this function does not work. The change seats button only works within one session, so this is no use either. How do we move seats from one session to another on the same date? Solution There is no button to move a (session) booking time. First find and open the booking and take screenshots of the current booking / allocated seats etc as is so you have a record of it to go back to (in case they need to refer to how it was). Then would need to first add the tickets for the relevant session for the new time at the required quantities to the existing booking (ensuring you check the prices of the new tickets added) and re-allocate the seats. Caveat, this will only be allowed if there are the tickets / seats available for the new time. Check these additions are correct, then I would save the changes at that point. They would then remove the tickets at the times they did not want - I believe it would be best to de-allocate seats before removing the tickets to ensure the seats are put back into availability in case just removing the tickets does not de-allocate the seats (old versions had issues with releasing seat availability this way it should negate that). Then check the booking looks as required and save the changes.
title: Moving a session booking time but not the date.
description:
Inability to change a session booking time when not changing the date.

Unable to move the booking to a different time on the same day.


e.g.

Our Father Christmas train have multiple sessions on one day.  
If we want to move a booking from one DAY to another DAY then the 'Move booking' button works fine.
But if we want to change the time but not the date of the booking this function does not work.
The change seats button only works within one session, so this is no use either.
How do we move seats from one session to another on the same date?


Solution

There is no button to move a (session) booking time. 
First find and open the booking and take screenshots of the current booking / allocated seats etc as is so you have a record of it to go back to (in case they need to refer to how it was). 
Then would need to first add the tickets for the relevant session for the new time at the required quantities to the existing booking (ensuring you check the prices of the new tickets added) and re-allocate the seats. 
Caveat, this will only be allowed if there are the tickets / seats available for the new time. 
Check these additions are correct, then I would save the changes at that point. 
They would then remove the tickets at the times they did not want - I believe it would be best to de-allocate seats before removing the tickets to ensure the seats are put back into availability in case just removing the tickets does not de-allocate the seats (old versions had issues with releasing seat availability this way it should negate that). 
Then check the booking looks as required and save the changes.

text: Issue: Promotions not working on some Mstore tills. First and obvious thing to check would be that till data has been re created There is also an issue where if the Language setting on the PC is set to US rather than UK this may cause an issue. This was particularly noticeable on Windows 11 installation. Installing the UK language pack and setting the PC to use UK resolved the issue. Confirmation from a customer below; I can now confirm that it was the date format. On the other till I changed the date format only and promotions started working. I suspect PMStore grabs the local date as a string and uses it to compare with the start/end date. As the format was different than expected, the date fell out of range which made the promotion invalid. I changed the region and language settings just in case we had another Winddows update defaulting regional settings.

Confirmation from a customer below;


I can now confirm that it was the date format. 

On the other till I changed the date format only and promotions started working.
I suspect PMStore grabs the local date as a string and uses it to compare with the start/end date. As the format was different than expected, the date fell out of range which made the promotion invalid.

I changed the region and  language settings just in case we had another Winddows update defaulting regional settings.

text: TABLE OF CONTENTS Introduction Using Member Mailing Introduction The following is a step by step example on how to use the ‘Member Mailing’ option within the ‘K3|mstore’ back office software. This option enables you to create your own data extracts from your member’s database which you can either (i) extract as a Microsoft Excel spread sheet, or (ii) mail merge to Microsoft Word. Using both functions requires you to have Microsoft Word and Excel already installed on your computer by your IT department. Please note that K3 Business Technologies (K3 BTG) can only support any problems experienced during the creation of the data extract in the ‘K3|mstore’. Once the data has been extracted into a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet, or merged into Microsoft Word, then any technical support or training for these applications is not provided by K3 BTG. Using Member Mailing The following instructions detail how to use member mailing to extract data. First, click on the ‘Members’ button. Next, select the ‘Mailing’ option. Select ‘Mail_Membership’ from the dropdown list. Now click on ‘Accept’. You will see the screen as shown below. We will now show you one specific example of how to extract member data, for memberships will expire between a selected date range. Select ‘Membership expiry date’ from the ‘Database Field’ dropdown as shown below. Now select 'Is between the values' from the ‘Comparison’ dropdown as shown below. Now select the required “from” date from the top ‘Value’ dropdown as shown below. Now select the required “to” date from the bottom ‘Value’ dropdown as shown below. Next click on the 'Accept' button. N.B. in this example we are only carrying out a simple search. If you wanted to add multiple ‘Search Criteria’ you could select other criteria from the ‘Database Field’ dropdown list here and add these additional criteria as required (using a similar procedure as detailed above). Once all the search criteria have been defined as required, click on ‘Extract’. If you want the results as a Microsoft Excel spreadsheet, click on 'Export Data To List'. The Microsoft Excel spreadsheet will be created automatically. Now click on the ‘Microsoft Excel’ icon on your Windows ‘Taskbar’ . This will open this spreadsheet so you can view and use this data as required. Alternatively, the results can be merged to a Microsoft Word mail merge template. First ensure you have selected the required Microsoft Word mail merge template. To do this click here to navigate to the required Microsoft Word mail merge template. Navigate to the required folder and click on the required Microsoft Word mail merge template. Next click on ‘Open’. Now click on the ‘Mail Merge’ to Word button. The mail merge will be created automatically. Click the ‘Microsoft Word’ icon on your Windows ‘taskbar’ to view the mail merge results. As explained previously K3 BTG do not provide support or training on Microsoft Word, but we have included some simple notes below on using the mail merge facilities in Microsoft Word. If the screens appear different when using mail merges on your version of Word, then please speak to your preferred IT training provider for advice. Please note that there is an issue with most versions of Microsoft Word when using mail merges whereby the toolbars at the top of the screen will not work unless you first minimise then maximise this window. Please minimise then maximise this window before proceeding. Once you have done this, click on the ‘Preview Results’ icon. This will show you what the merge results would look like if completed. Next click on ‘Finish and Merge’ to proceed with the mail merge. There are now three options that can be selected as shown here. These are detailed below. The options available in this dropdown menu are shown below. Each of these options is explained on the following pages. (1) ‘Edit Individual Documents’ Under the ‘Merge records’ section, select which record(s) you want to include: Select ‘All’ to edit all records. There are now three options that can be selected, which are detailed below. To edit only the record displayed select ‘Current record’. To edit only certain records, type a range in the text boxes. Next click on ‘OK’ to merge the required records into a Microsoft Word document. (2) ‘Print Documents’ Under the ‘Merge records’ section, select which record(s) you want to include: Select ‘All’ to print all records. To print only the record displayed select ‘Current record’. To print only certain records, type a range in the text boxes. Now click ‘OK’, which takes you to the printer selection screen. Now select the required printer. Click ‘OK’ to print all the merged letters. (3) ‘Send Email Messages’ In the ‘Subject line:’ text box, type a subject. From the ‘Mail format’ dropdown list, select the desired format for your message. Under the ‘Send records’ section, select which record(s) you want to include: Select ‘All’ to send email to all of your records. To send email for only the record displayed select ‘Current record’. To send email to only certain records, type a range in the text boxes. Caution: if you now click on ‘OK’ the email messages will be sent to your recipient(s).

text: If you have followed the Un-Cancel Non-Session Bookings Knowledge Base article, but are receiving the below error message, this is because you are trying to un-cancel a session based booking. Sessions have strict availability, and when cancelling this booking, the availability on that booking gets released, so that this can be booked by another customer. Therefore, you cannot re-allocate the session availability, as this could cause double-booking seats and overbooking on the session that would since have further bookings on it.
title: Cannot Un-Cancel Session Based Booking
description:
If you have followed the Un-Cancel Non-Session Bookings Knowledge Base article, but are receiving the below error message, this is because you are trying to un-cancel a session based booking. 



Sessions have strict availability, and when cancelling this booking, the availability on that booking gets released, so that this can be booked by another customer. Therefore, you cannot re-allocate the session availability, as this could cause double-booking seats and overbooking on the session that would since have further bookings on it.

text: Breakdown of each template style: Tickets: Tickets is generally used when you don't need to worry about availability and just want to sell tickets. Open dated will just give the option to sell as many tickets as you set available under each bookable resource. In most cases this can be set to 9999 and will just give unlimited availability. Setting to 10 on the bookable resource will limit how many tickets are available PER BOOKING, but this will not stop people from just making another booking. Date specified: Setting to date specified means the tickets are then only valid for one day, but using the ticket template style will not limit availability (aside the number per booking): Availability / Groups: Availability / Groups does take into account availability PER TIME SLOT. Generally this will be per day, but it is possible to have more than one time slot per day. Sold 6, refreshing the page: Once availability for the day is gone, the day will go red and no longer be bookable. Birthday Parties: Requires specialized set up. Session / Tours: This type of template is determined by the number of tickets allowed per session: (Set to 20 for testing)

text: Issue You are getting the below error "Page Header plus Page Footer is too large for the page" when trying to screen or print a report within MStore Back Office. This is due to your default Windows printer default page size is smaller than A4, which is what the report has been designed to fit on. This generally happens on tills with receipt and ticket printers. Solution Please go to this Microsoft support page to set your default printer to an A4 printer: https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/windows/set-a-default-printer-in-windows-e10cf8b8-e596-b102-bf84-c41022b5036f#id0ebf=windows_11. If you do not have a physical A4 printer connected to your PC, use a virtual printer (Microsoft Print to PDF or Microsoft XPS Document Writer) that are generally installed on all Windows PC's.

text: If you have setup Shopify items, but not via the MStore Back Office, and these items keep getting set to Draft. This will be because your integration has Allow deactivating of inactive products ticked. This means that any item in Shopify that is not ticked as a Shopify Item in the PLU Maintenance within the MStore Back Office (see screenshot below) or the item is not derived from MStore will be set to Draft. If you would like Allow deactivating of inactive products setting changed, please contact support via the portal to get this changed for you. However, this will mean you will need to manually set PLU's that were previously set as a Shopify Item in the MStore Back Office but now this has been unticked, to Draft.
title: Shopify Items Not Setup Through MStore Getting Set To Draft
description:

However, this will mean you will need to manually set PLU's that were previously set as a Shopify Item in the MStore Back Office but now this has been unticked, to Draft.

text: If you are using the VeriFone Ocius Sentinel integration with our MStore till, and you receive the PEDInESDRecoveryMode message on the till during a card payment, this is due to the card machine having a feature that detects static and will shut the card machine down to protect itself. This can be caused due to the card machine being in damp environments, on metal surfaces and/or close to other electronic devices, like detaggers and hearing loops. The short-term fix for this would be to unplug the card machine ONLY from the power source, wait 10 seconds, and then plugging it back in. Once you have done this, restart the till, where card payments should begin working again once the till has logged back in again. If this does not resolve the issue please do get in contact with our support team to help further with this. title: PEDInESDRecoveryMode When Taking Card Payment On MStore Till
description:
If you are using the VeriFone Ocius Sentinel integration with our MStore till, and you receive the PEDInESDRecoveryMode message on the till during a card payment, this is due to the card machine having a feature that detects static and will shut the card machine down to protect itself.


This can be caused due to the card machine being in damp environments, on metal surfaces and/or close to other electronic devices, like detaggers and hearing loops.


The short-term fix for this would be to unplug the card machine ONLY from the power source, wait 10 seconds, and then plugging it back in. Once you have done this, restart the till, where card payments should begin working again once the till has logged back in again. If this does not resolve the issue please do get in contact with our support team to help further with this.


Long-term prevention steps that can be taken by avoiding damp environments, metal surfaces and other electronic devices touching or being close to the card machine. You can also use anti-static clothes to wipe down surfaces in contact with the card machine, or cleaning cards for card machines can remove static.
